Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Court erred by solely using the physical presence test to determine residency
Decision_Outcome: Application allowed, case remitted for redetermination
Legal_Rule: 1095 days of physical presence required; functional residency may be considered
Procedural_Issue: Use of strict physical presence test without considering functional residency
Outcome_on_Merits: In favor of applicant on procedural grounds
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court must consider all relevant factors including functional ties
Key_Evidence_Considered: Duration and pattern of physical presence in Canada
Legal_Framework: Citizenship Act and related case law
Applicant_Challenge: Against strict interpretation of physical presence requirement
Defendant_Response: Enforcement of statutory physical presence requirement
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of travel and residence
Outcome: Remanded for reassessment under unified residency test
Remedy_Sought: Grant of citizenship upon proper assessment
Legal_Provision_Cited: Citizenship Act, s. 5(1) and related regulations
Applicable_Process: Citizenship application process, appeal to Federal Court
Governing_Rule: Physical presence test vs. functional residency test
